(Italy, 1955/2010) Directed by Michelangelo Antonioni. Screenplay by Michelangelo Antonioni and Suso Cecchi D’Amico, based on the novel by Cesare Pavese. Cast: Eleonora Rossi Drago, Valentina Cortese, Yvonne Furneaux, Madeleine Fischer, Anna Maria Pancani.

While restored classic French films pop up with regularity, the appearance of a rarely-seen restored new print of an Italian movie is an unexpected treasure! Prepare to be dazzled by an early masterpiece by Michelangelo Antonioni (La Notte, L’Avventura, Blow Up) that has never been released in the States. Antonioni’s talent for directing actresses is already evident in this story of a designer (Eleonora Rossi Drago) who leaves Rome to open a boutique in Turin. Offering the latest in haute couture, she quickly becomes the confidante of a group of women who take more sustenance from their friendships than from the unreliable men in their lives. “IMPOSSIBLE TO STOP WATCHING! The expressive elegance of Antonioni’s camera movements still has the power to amaze...” A. O. Scott, New York Times.
